intro: Backeria pallens, commonly known as the white-flowered backeria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Backeria pallens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
